name: Swiss Chicken Rolls
ingredients: 4 boneless chicken breasts, flattened until very thin
6 ounces Swiss cheese, cut into 4 equal pieces
3 1/4 ounces thin sliced deli-style smoked ham, 8 slices
8 ounces baby bella or cremini mushrooms, sliced

instructions.en: Assemble chicken rolls: Place ham slices on work surface, wrap around cheese, place on chicken breast, roll up chicken to enclose filling. Season with salt and pepper.
Heat 2 tablespoons butter and oil in skillet. Brown chicken rolls on all sides over medium-high heat.
Reduce heat to medium-low. Add mushrooms, wine, and broth. Cook chicken rolls 10-15 minutes, turning occasionally, until cheese starts to seep out.
Remove chicken rolls from pan. Add remaining butter to pan juices, adjust seasoning.
Slice each chicken roll into about 6 slices on the bias. Arrange on bed of spinach. Pour pan juices and mushrooms over chicken. Sprinkle with parsley if desired.

notes: Makes 4 servings. Do not freeze. Chicken rolls can be assembled ahead and refrigerated, but may need longer cooking time if cold. Use very thinly sliced ham to avoid bulkiness.
